title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youngstown State University in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was short and to the point. Make sure you have a good idea of what you are applying for and have good knowledge of what that job entail. Make sure you dont try to make up stories because if you get asked a follow up you might start to stutter
Interview Questions: Q: Have you ever had any technical issues and how did you deal with it ?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youngstown State University (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience. It was a beautiful building. A great group of people that I interviewed with. I really enjoyed the interview. It was organized, and well detailed.

title: Student Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Youngstown State University (Youngstown, OH) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by Web Team about my previous experiences with the web development. Level of experiences with HTML, CSS, and Drupal. Then I was interview by the supervisor and finally got offer. After that I was sent to fill out the paperwork.
Interview Questions: Web Development Experiences that I had.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youngstown State University (Youngstown, OH)
Interview Descriptions:
It was a relaxed environment just to see if you had a common area of potential interest.  

It was a way to see if you would be a good fit for the program. And to make sure you would stick with it as it is quite the comment.
Interview Questions: What areas of research are you passionate for?

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youngstown State University (Youngstown, OH) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy and I was engaged well. I was asked relevant questions and skills. The interview was laid back and I ended up doing very well and getting the job.
Interview Questions: What soft skills do you have for this position?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Youngstown State University (Youngstown, OH) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly lengthy. It took me 4 months to come onboard from the time of application. I applied in Sept 2018. I got Skype interview (1st round) in 1st week of Nov 2018. Then another video interview (2nd round)- Dec 1st week. I was then called on-site- 3rd week of Dec (3rd and last round) in Dec 2018. I received offer within 3 days.
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioral questions. few technical questions.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youngstown State University (Youngstown, OH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was overall pretty good and went by smoothly. I was asked standard interview questions and nothing too crazy. I had to fill out a lot of paperwork prior to the interview in order to qualify for the assistantship, the interview was the last part.

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youngstown State University (Youngstown, OH) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through an email. I received a telephone call and scheduled an interview. The interview was in person at the Youngstown State campus. Interviewer asked a lot of task and situational questions. Overall the interviewer was very nice, and was open to having a dialogue and going off script. The interview was supposed to be for 30 minutes, however it went for roughly an hour. The whole process took roughly a month.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult people?

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Youngstown State University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward from what I can remember.  You get interviewed by the people working there and they ask basic questions about the job to you, as well as just general small talk. There were no questions that were "out there" or any other weird things that I can think of.
Interview Questions: What do you know about computers?

title: Student Technical Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youngstown State University (Youngstown, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: A few questions about the educational background. A few questions about my ability to perform the works done. Very well environment to get the interviews done. it took me just 30 minutes to clear off the interview and was quite well happy with the proceedings.
Interview Questions: A few questions about the educational background.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youngstown State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a good set of interviews. The employees were courteous. The department chair was helpful in explaining the job and environment and was also helpful after hire in orientation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current job?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youngstown State University

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Youngstown State University (Youngstown, OH) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: No interview was performed since this was a graduate research assistant position. However, you do have to submit academic transcripts and a cover letter stating what qualifies you for graduate school.

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youngstown State University (Youngstown, OH) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Must perform skills set including retrieving a ten pound brick from 12 feet of water in under a minute and forty seconds, have to tread water with hands above head for three minutes, swim 300 meters non-stop any stroke that you prefer.
Interview Questions: What would you do in case there was an emergency on deck?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youngstown State University (Youngstown, OH) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: After filling out the application and finding two professors to recommend me, the interview was very simple.  a few questions about what skills I was able to offer to the department, what hours would be best and what type of computer skills did I have.
Interview Questions: What computer skills do you have and can you update my website?
